resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/107192</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>107192</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1765086889</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">"The American Frankenstein."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">"Das Amerikanische Frankenstein."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">"Le Frankenstein Américain."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">"O Frankenstein Americano."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">"Il Frankenstein Americano."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">"Το αμερικανικό Frankenstein."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">"El Frankenstein Americano."</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Inspired by Mary Shelley's novel about a man-made monster who turned upon its creator, this cartoon depicted the railroad trampling the rights of the American people. Agriculture</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Angespornt durch Mary Shelleys Roman über ein 
synthetisches Monster, das nach seinem Schöpfer sich drehte, stellte 
diese Karikatur die Eisenbahn bildlich dar, welche die Rechte der 
amerikanischen Leute trampelt. Landwirtschaft</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Inspiré par le roman de Mary Shelley's au sujet d'un 
monstre synthétique qui a tourné sur son créateur, ce dessin animé
a dépeint le chemin de fer piétinant les droites des  américains. 
Agriculture</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Inspirado pela novela de Mary Shelley sobre um monster 
sintético que girasse em cima de seu criador, este cartoon descreveu 
a estrada de ferro que espezinha as direitas dos povos americanos. 
Agricultura</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Ispirato dal romanzo della Mary Shelley circa un monster 
artificiale che ha girato sul relativo creatore, questo fumetto ha 
descritto la ferrovia che calpesta i diritti della gente americana. 
Agricoltura</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Εμπνευσμένα από το μυθιστόρημα Mary Shelley's για
ένα προκαλούμενο από τον άνθρωπο τέρας που γύρισε επάνω στο 
δημιουργό του, αυτά τα κινούμενα σχέδια απεικόνισαν το 
σιδηρόδρομο ποδοπατώντας τα δικαιώματα των αμερικανικών ανθρώπων.
Γεωργία</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Inspirado por la novela de Maria Shelley sobre un monstruo
artificial que dio vuelta sobre su creador, esta historieta 
representó el ferrocarril que pisoteaba las derechas de la gente 
americana. Agricultura</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Menschlichkeit</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Sciences humaines</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Studi umanistici</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ανθρωπότητες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Humanidad</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>roleValues</source>
              <value>author</value>
            </role>
            <entity>BEGIN:VCARD
N:CENTER FOR HISTORY AND NEW MEDIA/AMERICAN SOCIAL HISTORY PROJECT
FN:CENTER FOR HISTORY AND NEW MEDIA/AMERICAN SOCIAL HISTORY PROJECT
VERSION:3.0
END:VCARD</entity>
          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1765086889</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>no</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">No License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>107192</entry>
    </identifier>

      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/libraries/the-american-frankenstein</uri>

    </item>
  </manifestation>
